values: It's weird that where I am now is so far removed from where I was then. I can only say, "me too." A little Smith's and I'm right back. In a good way though. It's more like bumping into an old friend that gut-wrenching longing....but still - me too!

Tom Robbins' new book.  I can't even begin to explain my excitement.

Excerpt from Seattle P I

"Throughout my so-called career (I'm more inclined to think of it as a "careen"), my goal (seldom articulated, even to myself) has been to twine ideas and images into big subversive pretzels of life, death and goofiness on the chance that they might help keep the world lively and give it the flexibility to endure.

The degree to which I've been successful I suppose only history can judge, provided history is not too preoccupied watching digital video to pay any notice to wood-pulp junkies like me. In any case, it doesn't matter much because after nearly 40 years of pursuing phantasmagorical novels down shadowy hallways, I've recently aimed my cognitive flashlight at an entirely different corner of the crumbling castle of literature.

Specifically, I've decided to write a children's book. A children's book about beer."

So we just got back from Memphis.

Day 1:

We began our long journey to Memphis by stopping at Hardee's for a big, greasy biscuit.



We made it to Memphis....and decided to check out Beale Street....My first sober BealeStreet experience in over 4 years!  I was designated photographer....which explains my lack of presence in the photos.





Then we went to the Peabody....to see the ducks.  The birds didn't amuse me half as much as the view!







So we finally made it to Sandy's....I say Sandy's because she OWNS that apartment!



So we got to see SandySandySandy....and we got to see Andrew.....and we got to see a lot of Sandy and Andrew doing this:





So then we went to SUPERTARGET!!! WOOHOO!!!

To throw snap-pops in the floor.

And to bitch slap our friends

to take over the world.  The toilet security is actually just a red herring.  They don't want other countries to discover the truth about W's inability to pee/poo.

George W. Bush is constipated.  "PUSH!!!"


George W. Bush is scared that foreign governments will obtain a sample of his pee or poo....and after many complicated genetic tests....finally have indisputable medical proof  that W is a dumbass!



George W. Bush actually wears adult diapers!  (He is 60 today....its not impossible)

Here's my top ten list about things that have SUCKED in the past seven days!

1.   Suki's sick.....She's got hairballs coming out of both ends....and she can barely walk right now...I don't know how to fix her.
2.   I was unalbe to consolidate my student loans by the June 30 deadline because Mohela's fax number was busy ALL DAY.  I should really stop procrasinating...but I'll start tomorrow.
3.   I got my new Spin in the mail.  Beyonce was on the cover (blah).  And most importantly....CHUCK KLOSTERMAN HAS WRITTEN NOTHING FOR THE LAST TWO MONTHS!!!  Chuck was the only thing good about Spin....I should cancel my subscription.
4.   I left my laptop and cell charger at home in Ripley....which resulting in me completing a four hour drive today.
5.   I'm almost out of wine and its Sunday.
6.   I'm no longer allowed to spend all day at work online.  Instead, I'll be staring at four brick walls and listening to the conservatives talk about black people.  Goodbye endless hours of internet goodness.
7.   I got a nail in my tire....and thus replaced all four....$250!
8.   My blood pressure is still not where my doctor thinks it should be....therefore....I'll be talking even MORE expensive drugs.
9.   My brother broke up with the only girl he's dated in 10 years that I actually LIKED.  It made me cry.
10. Okay....maybe I only had 9 bad things happened.  So here's my filler:  George Bush is still president.

BitTorrent really is the perfect analogy for a utopian society.
I have....I share.....You have
I want....You have....You share.....I have
Only the channels upon which we share restrict our human instinct to HORDE....You can have it all....but you gotta wait on it!
And Shaporky openly admitted that BitTorrent was the perfect example of karma...you get what you give...
Anyway, that's not really where I was going with this.....

I've been thinking more about the analogy of Super Mario Bros...the original..... to the essence of all that exists and that should exist.
Mario (or Luigi) can't go back. Nor can he look too far in the future. Mario...at any point within the game....is in the NOW....he's exactly where he should be (unless he's falling down a hole and you hear the inevitable....dodododoodooo)

Mario's purpose is to save the princess. He defeats the enemy and finds out that his journey has just began. There are more Koopas to defeat. But he doesn't quit....he's a persistent little plumber.

So how does Mario draw his strength? In a world consisting of mostly brick and mortar.....Mario draws his strength from nature....the mushroom, the flower, the star....to make him stronger....to keep him ALIVE.

And you can take short cuts....but if you take the long road....you get more experience...more coins....more life....

Anyway....I was just vaguely attempted to make sense of it all....
Surivatem and I are gonna write a whole book on Geeks and Philosophy.

How easily we take for granted the spoils of modern life..... We have instant access to information.....we've got men flying around in space......we've got countless forms of communication and methods of travel.....but what does everyone take for granted??
Water
 
That's right. You go to your faucet, turn the handle, and water comes out. And what happens when you go to your faucet, turn the handle, and water doesn't come out......????? You call me...and complain!
 
But before you waste the time to look up the phone number to the water department....to inevitably yell at me for something I can do NOTHING about....Please read the following.

The city will NOT reimburse you if you go buy bottled water. - You only pay for the water you use and the water that you dispose of (sewage).

Your first instincts are correct! The city didn't wake up this morning and say "Oh I'm really gonna f*** with the people that live in the west side." The largest water pipe in the city broke.....and if you feel the need to point fingers....then just blame God....because he was the one that shifted the earth and broke the pipe.

I know you wanna pee. But just use it and don't flush.....put the seat down....light some scented candles....spray some air freshener...and cross your fingers and hope you don't have to poo. The water WILL be back on soon!

I just can't tell you WHEN it will be fixed. (so stop yelling at me!) There's just no time table on opening up a ten foot hole in the ground and fixing a 12 inch line. The employees that are slaving away through their lunch don't care that you have to go to work dirty....they work in the dirt.....and right now all of us could use a shower. The point I'm making is that these men, (that get paid shit) work their asses off.....and they never get a thank you.

And a special note to all the reporters....particularly 

DON'T CALL ME A LIAR BECAUSE I CAN'T ANSWER QUESTIONS ABOUT PIPE. I work on a database and have no need nor desire to understand the inner workings of this city's water system. I told you "I was just answering phones"....and you kept prying....asking.....so I answered to the best of my ability....but following my statements with "I'm not sure about that"....is only because I didn't want you to quote false information. Investigative reporters should just dig a little deeper for their stories and actually call the people in charge....not the part time girl that answers the phone while everyone else is at lunch. (Bet you didn't know I was writing down everything you were saying too.....pretentious man reporter!)

I watched John Carpenter's Prince of Darkness last night.  A great cheesy 80's horror flick with a cameo zombie appearance by Alice Cooper.  I wasn't scared while watching the movie....because....well....I couldn't really get over the 'stache on this guy:



Come on....really....this guy has a broom on his upper lip.  It was so distracting....impossible to pay attention to the dialogue...cause...well everytime he spoke...I just heard the small dog barking on his face...ruff...ruff..*growls*



So I decided to do a little research on this strapping blonde beauty and his cookie duster.  Apparently, the owner of this soup strainer is none other than Jameson Parker. He was completely impossible to recognize...because....he kinda looks like a walrus. 



Parker used to be a Simon...on Simon and Simon.  But the other Simon had already claimed his moustache...and two whooping mos on prime time...well that would just never do.  The clean shave makes him look much younger. Don't you think?


 
Anyway, Parker now writes books and looks like this:



Ruff.....rurururuff.....ruff...ruff.....ruff.
Damn...will someone get this guy a Bic and a can of Barbasol!!

I'm not condoning his behavior.  But Pete Doherty has been providing me with constant entertainment for several months now.  His excessive drug abuse really is sad.  Yet somehow, I've managed to find the humor in the situation.  I mean there are pics of him injected an unknown unconscious fan with a syringe of something.  He's been arrested more times than anyone can count.  And then there were those drag pictures.  I mean..really...what's not to love.  But, this....this is his moment....his crowning achievement as a druggie....he shot the MTV crew with a syringe of blood.  Oh yeah! There's video. 
(If you wanna see more pics of Pete's crazy antics...just visit the archives of DListed and ONTD.  They usually have a new crazy Pete pic at least once a week.)

One of the key characters in Tom Robbins' Villa Incognito was a tanuki named Tanuki. Tanuki liked to drink sake and beat his drum, Plabong! But in Japan, tanukis are legend, a raccoon-badger-dog shapeshifters with a large scrotum.
Anyway, in Super Mario Bro. 3, when you got the little raccoon tail....that's actually a tanuki suit called tanooki.

Pan doesn't come from Robbins' imagination either.
*edit* "It is likely that the demonized images of the incubus and even the horns and cloven hooves of Satan, as depicted in much Christian literature and art, were taken from the images of the highly sexual Pan."

I got in from Tampa on Friday night.  I loved flying....I loved the conference...I LOVE AIRPORTS!!...but I didn't really love Tampa.  It's not really what I expected.  The nearest beach was 25 miles away...so I got little to no sunshine.  But it was nice to be outta school...and outta Mississippi for a few days.

Here's the view from our balcony window.  The building is the convention center where we had our seminars.  BTW, our Pi Omega Pi Chapter placed third in the nation!!



We did have a good time in Ybor (pronounced e-bore).  Here we are taking the trolley to Ybor.



Yes...our girl in the middle is wearing a popped collar...but in a funny way



I found this little 1984 reference



We went to a show at the Improv.  The comedian was a hypnotist.  He got two members of our group.  The hypnotist told the hypnotee's they were drunk.  It really worked.. and I refuse to divulge everything that occured at that show.  But I now believe that hypnotisms are real.  We weren't supposed to have cameras...so I only got the one pic.



Later on, we went to the James Joyce Irish Pub.  And how excited is Beth to enter a pub named after one of the most prominent figures in literary history...and one of Tom Robbins favorite authors.  I'm pretty sure I embarrassed myself here.  But we met some really cool teachers from all over the country.  Who knew you could rock it with some old people?  I'm pretty sure that we drunkenly told everyone we met that we were going to be educating the youth of America.



After quoting TR....giving the synopsis for most of his novels....and literally BEGGING....I finally convinced the bouncer for the shirt off his back.  It has a little stain on it...but who cares.



The back of the shirt says, "May you be in heaven an half hour before the devil knows your dead."

And here's all the girls.  After 12 hours of drinking....we've held up really well.




On a side note....I quit smoking...hurray!!
It must be a slow news day. Did this even warrant an entire article?

Well I'm losing my flight-nity tomorrow.  With any luck, my dreams of meeting Tom Robbins on a plane will come true.  Or maybe, they'll be snakes....and Samuel L. Jackson...who knows.

So what am I gonna miss during my week in Tampa? (In no particular order)

1.  WBFF - All Ben Folds; All the Time! The Saint takes a backseat when I have highspeed access and winamp.

2.  Infinite email threads with rebelbrad - Did you know gmail will only allow 150 replies in a thread before it creates an new email.

3.  Tuesday lunch with Shaporky - Subway might go out of business.  We must reclaim our portion of the Bulldog Den before the "Avoiding Men" infest the place with their shifty-eyed-we-only-see-their-backs germs.

Okay, there's probably more...but I'll not list them...because I'm sure the sand, sun, and ocean will lull any negative emotions.
I'll post pictures when I get back to Mississippi. 

BTW, The Polyphonic Spree will release their new album, Fragile Army, on July 3.  Maybe the summer release of their album will spark a summer tour that brings them very close to me.  Yah!!!

Please note the following:
The article never mentions BM's three Academy Awards.
It says the movie was "unsuccessful"...."drawing much of its viewing audience in cities known to have large homosexual populations." ..."shown in limited theaters" 

The movie was shown in Tupelo...Mississippi....in the Bible Belt....for several, several weeks.  I guess the AFA is feeling bad because they couldn't keep the "homosexual agenda" out of Tupelo's theater.  (Tupelo being the AFA's home.)

And what's up with this "homosexual agenda".  I think their confusing CIVIL RIGHTS with conspiracy theories.  Apparently, they believe all the "gays" got together, formed a club, and are now out to take over the world. Oh no! Watch out! They're coming to get you!

deronde's post has caused quite the little controversy.  I haven't seen that many people get opinionated since the last Jerry Springer ep I watched.

So I would just like to add this:

Clean air: No one has said anything about the vehicles and corporations dirty-ing up our atmosphere (and lungs).  Read more here and here.

Smokers: If the state legislature gets its way, it will be the smokers who fund the local governments.

Discrimination:  All this reminds me of a little incident that happened a few semesters ago.  I was standing on campus enjoying my first cigarette in several hours.  An overweight girl walks by with her Wendy's bag, dripping grease from the bottom, and says to me, "Smoking's bad for you."  Had I not been so shocked at her hypocritical comment, I would have formulated this response, "And clogged arteries from your greasy fast food.....real healthy."

But truthfully, I respect others desire to have clean lungs.  My issues with this ordinance extend no further than the government's ability to restrict and desire to control every aspect of human behavior.  I take the same issues with Patriot Act and other fascist laws.

The Starkville Board of Alderman passed the no smoking ordinance. Welcome to 1984!
You can read the ordinance here.
So here's my issues with this ordinance. 

First of all, I've never understood why the government has to step in to decide whether or not someone harms themselves. 
If I want to die a slow painful death from lung cancer...then dammit, its my right.
If I wanna die in a car accident because I wasn't wearing my seatbelt...then dammit, its my right.
If I wanna suffer brain damage because I didn't wear my motorcycle helmet....then dammit, its my right.

Second hand smoke, I can understand.  But haven't we already made proper allowances.  We already have designated areas for those who like to puff the tobacco.  If a business/restaurant wants, then THEY can make their institution non-smoking.  But of course, most restaurants will not do that because:
Drinkers tend to pay for very expensive alcohol. (You know 5 dollar shots 4 dollar beers.)
Drinkers tend to tip more.
And Drinkers like to smoke!!  (Even non-smokers will smoke while drinking.)

As a side note, I've never sat in the non-smoking area of a restaurant and smelled smoke.

Section 4 of the ordinance (page 4) says:
It shall be unlawful for any person to smoke in certain outdoor areas:
Immediately preceding or blocking the entrance and/or exit of an area where smoking is prohibited.

So who determines where "immediately" is?  Will the public institutions be required to block off an area around their entrances and exits so that smokers can be aware of their "safe zones"?  What if Mr. Police Mann is having a bad day...he sees you smoking several yards from the front door of Applebee's and bam--$50 fine.   Who will control those who control those who control........

I just really never thought that this would pass in Mississippi, especially a college town.  And most of the ordinance is not that big of deal.  I never saw anyone smoking in "retail stores" or "daycares" anyway.  But it really bugs me that the government can boss around the businesses.  Why not offer tax breaks to businesses that institute a no smoking policy?....allow the business owner to make their own decisions.  It is...after all...their business.
